H0.text: In weaving, what are the threads running parallel to the length of the cloth called. Weftline

H1.text: In weaving, what are the threads running parallel to the length of the cloth called. Lengthwise

H2.text: In weaving, what are the threads running parallel to the length of the cloth called. Parallelon

H3.text: In weaving, what are the threads running parallel to the length of the cloth called. WARP

A4.text: It is regarded as the longitudinal set in a finished fabric with two or more sets of elements.

A5.text: The warp is the set of yarns or other things stretched in place on a loom before the weft is introduced during the weaving process.
